Erowid name: cyclobenzaprine
Category: PHARMS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    Donate and receive yours!

Cyclobenzaprine



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

Flexeril; Cycoflex

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Skeletal Muscle Relaxant; Sedative

CHEMICAL NAME

3-(5H-dibenzo[a,d] cyclohepten-5-ylidene)-N,N-dimethyl-1-propanamine hydrochloride

DESCRIPTION

Cyclobenzaprine is a CNS depressant and skeletal muscle relaxant. It is effective at relieving muscle spasms of local origin without interfering with muscle function but is ineffective in treating muscle spasms due to cns disease. It is also prescribed as a sleep-aid.

CAUTION

Should not be used within 14 days after use of an MAOI.

BASICS

EFFECTS

IMAGES

HEALTH

LAW

DOSE

CHEMISTRY

EXPERIENCES #

A Voyage Into the Hall of Insanity, by WhiteRabbit

My Lover, by Questionable

The Beauty of Being Opiated, by Guru Sigma

Love/Hate Relationship, by Biglost2008

                    Context: 
                    This chunk is from Erowid's detailed entry on cyclobenzaprine (Flexeril; Cycoflex), a prescription skeletal muscle relaxant and CNS depressant. It includes names, classification, chemical details, usage description, safety cautions, links to further sections (effects, health, law, dose, chemistry), personal experience reports, and authoritative off-site resources. It appears within the Pharmaceuticals Vault section, offering information for users seeking facts, safety, and first-hand accounts about cyclobenzaprine.
